org.pac4j.core.credentials.authenticator

Interface Authenticator<C extends Credentials>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractProfileService, CasAuthenticator, CasRestAuthenticator, CouchProfileService, DbAuthenticator, DbProfileService, InMemoryProfileService, IpRegexpAuthenticator, JwtAuthenticator, KerberosAuthenticator, LdapAuthenticator, LdapProfileService, LocalCachingAuthenticator, MongoAuthenticator, MongoProfileService, OAuth10Authenticator, OAuth20Authenticator, OidcAuthenticator, RestAuthenticator, SAML2Authenticator, SimpleTestDigestAuthenticator, SimpleTestTokenAuthenticator, SimpleTestUsernamePasswordAuthenticator, YahooAuthenticator

    public interface Authenticator<C extends Credentials>
    An authenticator is responsible for validating Credentials and should throw a CredentialsException if the authentication fails.
    Since:
    1.7.0
    Author:
    Jerome Leleu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void validate(C credentials, WebContext context)
      Validate the credentials.

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        void validate(C credentials,
              WebContext context)
       throws HttpAction,
              CredentialsException
        Validate the credentials. It should throw a CredentialsException in case of failure.
        Parameters:
        credentials - the given credentials
        context - the web context
        Throws:
        HttpAction - requires a specific HTTP action if necessary
        CredentialsException - the credentials are invalid
